description.narrative: Efficient, safe and transparent cash transfer increased IDPs dignity, protection and access to inclusive financial services
seat of a second-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Marawi, officially the Islamic City of Marawi, is a 4th class city and capital of the province of Lanao del Sur, in Mindanao Island, in Southern Philippines

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
At least 5,000 IDPs were recipient of cash grants and emergency livelihood assistance
1. Number of IDPs with immediate access to basic needs (food and nonfood) through digital cash platform 2. Number of IDPs employed through cash for work or cash for care work activities utilizing digital cash platform 3. Number of people with recovered asset/diversified livelihood thorugh digital cash platform 4. Percentage of women receiving cash transfer benefits through digital cash platform 5. Number of people owning personalized iAFFORD prepaid card (digital cash platform) 6. Amounts distributed through the digital cash transfer platform 7. Extent to which beneficiaries experience increased control on managing cash support to meet basic needs and faster income recovery through the digital cash platform 8. Number of micromerchants activated or accredited for cash payout and selling of basic goods 9. Number of Knowledge Products of the results of the analytical and consultation work on financial inclusion, Islamic finance and gender 10. Percentage of women participating in the analytical and consultations work 11. Number of women and men trained/capacitated on household financial inclusion strategies for gender protection and empowerment 12. Number of advocacy materials developed promoting financial inclusion, including Islamic finance, as a strategy for strengthening social protection and long term development 13. Percentage of women participating in trainings and capacity building on financial inclusion, Islamic finance and gender

comment.narrative:
Largely -- 10,000 most vulnerable IDPs gained access to financial inclusion programs
